definitions.title: n.m.
definitions.body: :Nu 11:9 manna (= Ar. man=a, known to Beduin in Sin. Penin.; a juice exuding in heavy drops from twigs (some say also the leaves) of Ṭarfa (ṬuÉrfa) tree (tamarix gallica mannifera) in W. Sin. Penin., end of May and in June, sweet, sticky, honey-like; cf. Di:Ex 16:36 Rob:BRi. 75, 115, 590 Eb:GS 233 ff., 574 ff. Soc:ZMG xxxv.1881, 254);—´[[מ]] abs. Ex 16:15 + 12 t., sf. [[מַנְֵ]] Ne 9:20:—manna: [[וַיּאׁמְרוּ מָן הוּא כִּי לאׁ יָֽדְעוּ מַה־הוּא]] Ex 16:15, v:Ex 16:31, v:Ex 16:33, v:Ex 16:35, v:Ex 16:35, Nu 11:6, Nu 11:7, Nu 11:9 (described Ex 16:14, Ex 16:31, Nu 11:7, accomp. dew Ex 16:14, Nu 11:9); ceased after Israel reached Canaan Jos 5:12, Jos 5:12 ; as 2nd acc. [[הֶאֱכִילְ ְאֶת־הַמָּן]] De 8:3, cf. v:De 8:16 [[מָן לֶאֱכׂל זַיַּמְטֵר עֲלֵיהֶם]] Ps 78:24; [[וּמַנְ ְלאׁ־מָנַעְתָּ מִפִּיהֶם]] Ne 9:20.
